title: Understanding Data-Driven Reverse Engineering Processes for High-Performance Copper Alloy Design

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Case-centered learning utilizing smartphone-based collaboration tools applicable to industrial settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of data-driven reverse design systems in copper alloy design.
Learners can analyze the interaction between P2C (performance-composition prediction) and C2P (composition-performance prediction) modules using visualization tools.
Learners can simulate a copper alloy optimization design process through team-based projects in a resource-constrained technical environment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
